meanings.definition: Relating to the natural cycles of physical, emotional, and intellectual activity in living beings.
meanings.sent1: The biorhythmic dance of the seasons guides nature's rhythm.
meanings.sent2: She felt more energetic when her biorhythmic patterns were in sync.
meanings.sent3: The biorhythmic beat of the music made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent4: His biorhythmic routine was as steady as a ticking clock.
meanings.sent5: The biorhythmic flow of the river mirrored the ebb and flow of life.

meanings.definition: A person's biorhythmic cycles can affect their overall well-being.
meanings.sent1: Understanding your biorhythmic cycles can help improve your health.
meanings.sent2: Her biorhythmic chart showed peaks and valleys throughout the month.
meanings.sent3: The biorhythmic alarm clock woke him up gently with soothing sounds.
meanings.sent4: The biorhythmic harmony of her routine brought balance to her life.
meanings.sent5: His biorhythmic cycles seemed to sync perfectly with the phases of the moon.

meanings.definition: The biorhythmic patterns of animals are often influenced by environmental factors.
meanings.sent1: The zookeepers monitored the biorhythmic cycles of the animals closely.
meanings.sent2: The migration patterns of birds follow a biorhythmic rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The biorhythmic patterns of the squirrels seemed to sync with the changing weather.
meanings.sent4: The biorhythmic clock of the forest ticked in harmony with the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The biorhythmic dance of the fireflies lit up the night sky in a mesmerizing display.
